thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: No Uverse (so no TV PHONE INTERNET) for the past two days in north Alabama.  NO MOVIES! NO FOOTBALL! NO EMAIL!!! NO HOME PHONE SERVICE!  In minutes I called and reported outage.  I was told it was an area outage and should be fixed by the next AM.  That was a total story.  So I called today and was told it would be fixed by 10 PM (11 EST).  Again nope.  Called again and this time was told it should be restored within 24-hours.  Really?  The worlds best funded communication company can't even communicate the truth about what's wrong with their customers!   This is a total fail by ATT.  I feel about as appreciated as a heel on a worn out shoe.  I'd rather be told a straight believable scenario even if they say it will be a week (no excuse for long outage though as weather wasn't a factor).  I feel sorry for any business needing a phone and a credit card machine depending on ATT.  Glad I jumped ship at my biz over three years ago and haven't regretted it at all.  Stuff like this makes me want to ditch wonky Uverse at my home.  It never lived up to any of the claimed performance in my market anyway.

raw message: I host a dedicated server from home with lots of networking equipment and AT&T, and we've been having intermittent connection all weekend and now completely dead this morning. I'd expect better from AT&T, we've had no outages in the last two years of using AT&T and now when we get one it's a very big outage spread out over 4 days. thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: A ticket means that someone reported a problem with their service and needs the network team to look into it. A confirmed outage means the network team and confirmed a specific issue with the service and has dispatched techs to repair the service. It can take several tickets to support an investigation into the service. Download ‚ÄúMark the Spot‚Äù from the App Store to report any issues as wel.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: Try changing the DNS to a public one like Google's. Generally if service comes up as perfect on the box, but nothing comes up correct on your devices, the ISP is having issues with their DNS. 8.8.8.8 is the address. You can change it in your IPv4 settings found by going to your wireless/ethernet adapter properties.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: I'm at the ATT page for Boston, MA.  The page for reporting an outage is interlaced with ads, and it quite hard to distinguish the ads from the page itself.  I actually clicked on a clickable within an ad, thinking that clicking on that spot was actually part of reporting process.  Can't remember what the word was, but something neutral, like "click here for info."  Turned out to be an ad for some PDF software.  After I extricated myself from that, the ad that replaced it is some people-finder thing, where you are supposed to enter a name and a phone number.  Again, it looked like something that ATT might plausibly be asking someone to fill out as part of the process of reporting service problems.  Whoever is putting up these ads seems to KNOW what kind of page they are appearing on, and is putting up ads that might plausibly be misinterpreted as being part of the actual ATT page.    And by the way, it sure seems tacky to me for ATT to be putting ads on a customer service page.  Kind of like putting a vending machine in a funeral parlor.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: All TV and Amazon Prime and some Netflix went out last night (10th May) around 7pm.  Wi-Fi remained active then and since.   This happened just after a notice appeared that AT&T needed to make a network change which required a reset on the WPS and WAP.     Shutdown was automatic but the system didn't come back active.    Spent 3 hrs on the on-line help to the usual of resetting WPS, etc. but system never came up, and then on-line chat with an agent and then with supervisor who had us do the same things that we had already done during on-line refresh of system and even before going on-line.     Instructed us to do more questionable fiddling and first agent finally concluded that it was the wireless receiver that was bad and that they would have to FedEx us a new one but that one wouldn't arrive until Tuesday  (i.e., meaning being without internet service for 4 days.    We requested some quicker option so we were then transferred to a supervisor (Trevor).    Initial agent and supervisor had deep english names though they were likely not real names given the poor english writing and grammar and continued problems with understanding simple requests to resolve the issue.   Trevor finally said that we would have to contact UPS and gave us a link to UPS but nothing else (made no sense) and then he promptly cut the chat off. This didn't seem to be an equipment issue from the start, and the first contact representative and the supervisor didn't appear to be competent to do basic assessment of the problems.     Calls to AT&T have been substantial during the past 24hrs, which also seemed to b e related to the system update excercise.   The AT&T agents presented as incompetent from the start, and just didn't care.     Going to terminate service with AT&T within next few days.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: If you find an internet source you can piggy back off it for phone service. (This is not the same as simply logging in to a nearby WiFi Connection for internet surfing.)  In your iPhone settings (most phones have similar wording and options) click on "Cellular", then click on "Wifi Calling" and click on "Wifi Calling on this Phone" and then accept the disclaimer if one pops up. Whenever ATT is down or lagging the phone will automatically utilize the nearest available WiFi. Same goes with people on other phone services. Get over it people, crap happens, either deal with it or get left behind.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: Hi Jason,  I'm not associated with AT&T at all (other than also being a customer with the 1000mbps plan), but the reason you're not reaching 1000mbps is probably due to the hardware you're trying to download/upload with. For example, even if I have "access" to 1000mbps, my PS4 or my Laptop that was made in 2015 is a limiting factor since they will only download content at about 70-100mbps in an absolute optimal setting.  Long story short, if you bump down to the next lowest tier plan you probably wouldn't notice a difference in quality and would save a few bucks every month. Hope this explanation helped!

raw message: No service in Daphne 36526. But what really aggravates me is that I had to go somewhere else to find this out, we use AT&T for everything and you would think they would have some kind of alert or message or something saying the network is down.....??? Instead I have been accusing my wife of not paying the phone bill correctly! I have had too many problems with AT&T both Wi-Fi and cellular, for the second biggest phone carrier you would think they would have better operations and procedures in place to alert people when there is an outage. I bought the 1000 Wi-Fi from AT&T and had nothing but problems since day one!  I can still only connect at about 32 megabytes a second it took an Act of God to get someone out here at all, in fact, when you call AT&T (India) you basically get treated like you are an idiot or accused of lying.... and then when you finally do get a technician to come out he has no idea what he is doing and can't answer simple questions about the router or the network. And for all of the trouble that you have to go through what do you get? Nothing, not even an apology. You would think maybe they would give you a credit or something, not these days! You should be allowed out of your contract automatically after so many problems, I am getting ready to go regardless, it is more trouble than it is worth, all of it.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: ANSWER: Merger Synergies and Debt Reduction: The company expects total WarnerMedia synergies to reach a run rate of $2.5 billion by the end of 2021. About $1.5 billion will be cost synergies, including efficiencies in marketing and procurement functions and corporate overhead. The remaining $1 billion are revenue synergies expected from additional sales opportunities, lower subscriber churn and higher advertising. The company expects to reach a run rate of about $700 million by the end of 2019, increasing to $2 billion by the end of 2020 and ramping to $2.5 billion by the end of 2021. AT&T expects to end 2018 with a net-debt-to-adjusted-EBITDA ratio of about 2.8x, which it plans to reduce to the 2.5x range by the end of 2019, implying an $18 billion to $20 billion reduction in debt. The company expects to use about $12 billion in free cash flow after dividends to pay down debt in 2019. It also expects to generate cash of at least $6 billion to $8 billion from other opportunities, including real estate sale-lease backs, sales of non-core assets and working capital initiatives. Mobility: The Mobility business unit represents nearly half of AT&T‚Äôs adjusted EBITDA and about 40% of its revenues. The company expects Mobility to continue to deliver top- and bottom-line growth. Mobility is growing both service revenues and EBITDA and will continue to do so in 2019. The company expects its leadership in 5G and its FirstNet deployment will help sustain this growth. The company announced today that it has launched LTE-LAA technology ‚Äî with theoretical peak speeds of up to 1Gbps ‚Äî in 31 markets across the United States. The company has the best wireless network in the United States, according to GWS. Had to lol @ the last sentence.... "not right now they don't!" :D **Entire story here:** https://about.att.com/story/2018/att_provides_update_on_strategy_guidance_for_2019.html

It seemed to be going down in "package-chunks" -- the baseball games were gone first, then other sections like movies, until soon all channels were gone.  After several useless reboots which the TV-message said to try, we called AT&T. We were on hold for at lest 20 minutes before even being able to get through to a customer service rep. While on that hold, the automated recording said that the lines were busy due to an unusually high call volume. When this call-volume issues was mentioned, the online service rep said it was OUR actual system that was having a problem however, NOT the network (???). He tried several methods to get our connection back, but failed. He then set us up for a tech to come out to our house --- but the earliest time would be 8/24-Saturday!! When we woke up the Friday morning, we found that the TV service had been magically restored!! We did not bother calling AT&T since we had already spent over an hour of our time on the phone with them the previous night‚Ä¶  We finally had a phone call Friday evening from that same AT&T service rep. He said that it HAD been a wide-area outage, and so a tech would not be needed to come out....! He mentioned that our system appeared to be connected & working again from his test-program‚Ä¶but to call back to them if we had ongoing or new problems arise. So--------do they purposely keep their phone Service Reps in the dark about what is happening, or do they actually expect people to not find out that they were right --- "high call volume" + sudden loss of signal = ATT service outage !!!???!!!??? Dear ATT -- people do NOT like to be lied to, or called dumb, etc etc etc PS - Our Internet & Phone were both working yet.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: Latest update from Tech Support: AT&T has been having major problems with its Charlotte servers going back to Sept 21st. I've only had a problem with access to my voicemail since Oct 4th. One reason may be fixes implemented since 9/21 have been affecting other customers negatively. I've made the decision this afternoon to have my voicemail moved to a new server. This means any messages on my old voicemail account will be lost, including any I have never accessed -- that along with any existing voicemail settings or greetings. Because of the server problems, AT&T is unable to access my account either, to determine just how many heard and unheard messages I currently have. So switching to a new server can't be any worse than things are right now, since there is NO estimate of when the problem will be fixed on the old server, if ever. The longer I wait, the more (potential) messages I may never get to listen to from this point on. Tech says that I will be contacted by an AT&T rep within 24-48 hours, once the voicemail server move has been completed. Crossing my fingers.

raw message: You can thank the FCC. The regulatory burden put on telecoms is explicitly prohibitive. It's intended to keep the bigs in, and everyone else out...and that is why our service sucks. Because the system is set up specifically to make it that way. Without such regulations, we'd be able to compete with them, and develop better telecom protocols/hardware. It's worked in cryptocurrency, so I'm pretty sure it will work with telecoms too.  -Oz

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: Our internet has been out in 38134 since 11:30 am 4/23/20. The only way I know this is an outage is because I have the Smart Home Manager app. I also downloaded the myAT&T app and was able to chat with a human by clicking "Support," then scrolling to the bottom to click "Call us or chat with us online," then when it said "It's taking longer than normal to reach us...," clicking "My Internet," scrolling until I saw "Prefer to chat?" Once the "Chat" button appeared, I clicked on it and wrote "Human specialist" and was able to get in contact with a person eventually. They told me it would be 18 hours from 8 am 4/24/20, which means 4 am 4/25/20. They said they had to get permission from authorities to have a team of 4 work together on the repair due to the pandemic. Don't know the accuracy of all of that, but it was helpful to at least have some information. I didn't find out if it was weather related or not, but my assumption is that it's lightning or power line down because it happened during the rain yesterday.

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: My wife and I live in Eastman, Ga. 60 miles South of Macon, We use the AT&T Country Internet service through a local vendor. I assume he in turn gets the service through a vendor out of Atlanta, it's 4G LTE wireless Internet that comes through a small wireless Router that uses an AT&T SIM card. Our Internet went out some time after 4 Am on Monday nite, Tuesday morning and hasn't been back since, however yesterday the two indicator lights ..Being the Network and Signal lights were just yellow, but all day Thursday thet had turned Red which is kinda weird because the AT&T towers around us are working from what I can tell and we even use CRICKET wireless as our Cell provider which is Provided by AT&T. It's as if the SIM card is no longer active and isn't allowing the Router to access the network. We had an issue once when the Internet just stopped and come to find out the Local guy we pay for internet had changed vendors and we weren't notified in any way until I called and was told we needed to come pick up a new SIM card. For $85.00 a month I would have thought we would be on a group email in order to get notifications of such an issue. That Invoice for the monthly $85.00 seems to show up on time...every month!! It is for what is called Unlimited Internet but the best we get is maybe 12Mbps and that's around 4am..peak hours it never gets better than 1.75Mbps and it is THROTTLED TO DEATH it seems to me because of the way the Speed is constantly up and down...mostly down though!! Is there any way to check and see where our service is actually coming from and if its through a 2nd,or 3rd party vendor? I dont mean to sound like im bitching..but..yes im bitching!! It's all HURRY UP AND WAIT with this BS!!

thread: AT&T outage or service down? Current problems and outages
raw message: My elderly parents in their 80's have been out of home telephone service since last Wednesday, 9-16-20 at approximately 6:30 A.M.  Today is Sunday, 9-20 at 5:45 P.M. Neighborhood telephone service below Belle Chasse, LA, was restored within 24 hours in my parents neighborhood, yet, my elderly parents are still without phone service.  Their grandson went to their home to trouble shoot and make sure it was not an issue with the phone inside the house.  It is on the telephone company's side. He has called, but nothing has happened and the issue is still unresolved.    My elderly mother flagged down an AT&T worker in the neighborhoogd today and explained the issue to him and asked why everyone else had phone service and she still did not.  His reply to her was "Your guess is as good as mine, but I'll pass on the information."  How helpful and caring of him!  The road on the extra mile is never crowded!  I am their daughter and have also attempted to call today, but AT&T is not available on Sundays.  I plan to call tomorrow at 7 A.M. when AT&T opens.    There was no issue due to hurricane Sally.  This outage was due to a driver hitting a pole.  This issue should not have taken this long to resolve, considering everyone in the neighborhood has had telephone service restored.
